item.title: AWS CLI
item.description: You can accomplish all of the tasks in this workshop using the CLI, or Command Line Interface. As an aspiring CloudOps admin, it would be a good idea to be familiar with the CLI. Install and configure the CLI here. See if you can perform these tasks with the CLI: Launch an EC2 instance Configure the security group Create an EBS volume Attach the volume to an EC2 instance Delete the EBS volume Terminate the EC2 instance

item.title: Automation
item.description: All of the tasks we completed to launch an EC2 instance and install Apache httpd can be automated with a tool called Cloudformation. What would we have to do? Launch an EC2 instance Install the Apache web server (use userdata) Add some content Configure the security group Add and configure storage Move the web content Configure Apache httpd to point to the new web location Download and launch this template in the AWS Cloudformation Console to peform all of the steps in exercises 1-5.
